name: reservedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone does something reservedly, they do not talk about or show their feelings or thoughts: "It was all right," she said reservedly. He was reservedly positive about the news, so you couldn't tell what he really thought about it.
More examplesFewer examplesI say "probably" reservedly because you never know what might happen in the future.The supporters were reservedly optimistic, not wishing to risk things by saying anything too positive.She looked elegant but reservedly self-composed in the portrait.
